review: Worked very well in the beginning. Then started failing and had to take 2 pills plus other laxatives to have a BM. High price too.  Not going to continue. Managing with OTC laxatives instead.
Excellent and no side effects for me. It helped a lot.

I have been unable to go to the restroom normally for over a month. I was prescribed linzess by my doctor. The first time I took this med it was around 10 minutes it sounded like Godzilla was screaming in my stomach. Then it hits and you are in a full prairie dog panic. Then is the immediate relief of all the pressure being gone in literally 2 seconds. It was over a months worth of paperwork in 10 sittings in a span of about 4 hours. I was scared to leave the house all day. It was like being epsom salt pranked in a drink. The 2nd time was the same so I take it on my Fridays to have a day to recover. This stuff works and make sure to be courteous and flush ALOT.

My experience taking Linzess is nothing what I expected. I IBS-C so my dr prescribed Linzess. I asked if it was anything like a laxative because I don't like taking laxatives. He insisted it wasn’t so I decided to give this a try. First 2 days I wanted to die. I haven’t left the toilet in hours. I felt like I took a laxative but without the cramps. This medication is good to use if you 100% can’t go but I really don’t know how someone can take this everyday. Especially if you have work, school or if you ever have to leave the house. I have a part time job at a hospital and I’m a full time college student I really don’t have the time to be exploding in the toilet every 5 minutes. I was expecting to have regular bowel movements not constant diarrhea. I’m disappointed but if you take it as needed I guess it’s a quick fix.

Haven’t got a specific diagnosis (IBS-C vs chronic constipation), but was given samples to try because the chronic constipation was causing an anal fissure to not heal. About 2 weeks into therapy it finally kicked in, and I was having a bout of diarrhea in the morning. This was seriously inconvenient; how do you manage if you have to be somewhere? Maybe take it WAY earlier? I also noticed that the initial bit of stool was quite hard every morning, which was painful as always, followed by diarrhea. But I have sleep problems, so forcing myself awake extra early isn’t fun. I stopped taking it before the samples ran out. However, I’m going to give it another try. My doc suggested I drink less (only when thirsty) but I’m not sure how I feel about that as I tend to get easily dehydrated and live in bone-dry Colorado. One huge positive I noticed though was that my gas/bloating went away. After the diarrhea I had almost no gas for the rest of the day. So that was really fantastic.

It worked for the first ten days, after that it worked only off and on. Usually diarrhea immediately after taking it, then followed by constipation. Now it doesn't work at all, just makes me more uncomfortable after I have taken it.

I haven’t seen any others talk about this side effect, but the nausea I get from linzess is severe. I’m on the middle dose, so maybe I’ll try going down. I take it when I absolutely need to have a bowel movement and I know that I can stay in bed all day because of the nausea.

My doctor gave me this to prep for a scope. I asked if diarrhea was a side effect and if it was it would be unbearable severe. Within a couple of taking this med I didn't stop going for over 2 hours. I got up, sat down for 5 minutes and ran to the bathroom. The next 4 hours were spent this way and it still hasn't ended.

I have IBS-C and Linzess worked pretty well for me. The times I do take it, I’m making sure that I’m near a toilet for the next couple hours because oh my god this makes you poop, a lot. It works really well if you regulate it and know when to use it for yourself. It’s different for everyone and I only take it whenever I feel really backed up now. I’d say be careful when first using it though. I’m at the lowest dosage now, but when I first tried it at the medium dose, I became pretty dehydrated and had to stop using it for a while. Talk to your doctor about how best to use it for yourself.

I've had chronic IBS  for over 10 years w/last five years serious issues with switching randomly the IBS type D vs C.  That makes getting a bowel regiment complicated/ difficult.  I have tried almost everything and nothing has worked.  Miralax, supplemental fiber and laxatives are actually not a good long term solution because it can worsen the constipation long term. My doctor prescribed this medication I started out on the low dose it was a miracle however the price of this miracle came at a cost.  The cost being that you cannot trust so fart you will be in the toilet for a few episodes of going to the bathroom until it has subsided. Sensation is pretty specific your stomach will rumble w/feelings of impending bowels. Be near a toilet do not use prior to going to the airport/ car ride I actually had to go up in dose and I use it at 11pm for 7am BMs timed right for the right bowel patient it is excellent. Those of you having issues may required lower dose or your problem may not suit linzess.

I was prescribed this medicine by my GI doctor before undergoing a major open abdominal surgery for MALS (Median Arcuate Ligament Syndrome). Part of me wishes I would've began taking this medicine sooner, but I was worried about the "side effects" everyone keeps talking about. I firmly believe now if I had taken Linzess sooner, then I could've avoided having a Post-Op Ileus which the hospital was responsible on the day of my discharge. I began taking Linzess after consulting with my GI about 1 month after my discharge & one the day I took the medicine, I had been constipated for 4 days. My GI doctor has me on 72 mcg/daily & starting from the first day I took the medicine it has been very beneficial to me. I do not feel the need to increase the medication (even as directed) because I typically have at least 1 bowel a day (92% effective for me). I do also agree that things like high caffeine, any alcohol or high stress (like intense exercise) reduces the efficacy of the medication.

This drug has been a lifesaver for me. I suffer from severe IBS-C, to the point of having to do multiple colonoscopy preps to get relief after 9 days without any bm. Once my body got used to Linzess (after about 1-2 weeks of the side effects many describe), I’m basically just normal. Sometimes I’ll have an urgent be if I am not careful to follow the 30 min before food recommendation, but otherwise it’s been just amazing how much this makes has improved my quality of life.
I started using this about 2 weeks ago and doesn't work. I  go to the bathroom every 3 days ..
This gives me a massive headache 10 minutes after taking it. The headache lasts more than 12 hours. Four rounds of 2 Acetaminophen and a Maxalt (Migraine) I can finally go to sleep.

Linzess works. It does have a major flaw. It can affect the stomach for hours. It also may upset your stomach and have you running periodically  to the bathroom. I'm taking it twice a week to curb unwelcome side effects. My advice is to plan when not to take it in order to enjoy your day.

It does cause loose stool. I find the same day it’s loose the next day I take it I’m constipated. I have to push real hard to have a bowel movement. It feels like the loose stool is able to pass the collection of harder stool leaving behind more formed stool. I ended up in the hospital impacted. The stool had a strange odor.

I have IBD with C. I like Linzess. I use it like a laxative once or twice a week in the evenings after work. I can take it around 5 pm and conclude the "trotting back and forth to the bathroom" well before bedtime. The only thing I wonder is will my constitution ever be "normal"?

I just cannot! Because of my IBS , I bounce between symptoms of nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and constipation. Yes Linzess works, but oh wow! I don't know how anyone takes this drug frequently. There has been nothing but straight liquid explosions. You definitely cannot underestimate urges to pass gas as it is likely just more watery stool (found out the hard way). I sat on the toilet so long that my lower extremities went numb but I couldn't get up to stretch because every time I would try more stool would come rushing like a flood. There were light stomach cramps and some bloating but nothing too severe. I will keep this medication on hand and use it merely as a laxative if I again experience a string of days with no bowel movement. But, there is no way on Earth I would take this pill every day or even every other day. I’d never be able to leave my home.

Is this supposed to work? I’ve been on it for 5 days now and I had terrible cramps but had soft stool after 4 hours. Day 2 I had watery stool once and cramps. I've had Diverticulitis, ulcerative colitis and IBS. I have also had 4 feet of my colon removed. I took this and spent the next five hours in the bathroom. I ended up having to use pepto bismol to help it stop. Straight liquid. I'll be looking into something else.

I have been dealing with severe constipation from IBS-C which is exacerbated by a medication I have to take for over a decade.  I have tried literally every lifestyle, diet, supplements, and OTC laxative you can think of.  Linzess has been absolutely life changing for me.  I take it 30 mins before breakfast.  Most days I have a completely normal BM within 2 hours of eating.  If I don’t I always have one that day, just after lunch or dinner instead.  I have not experienced any diarrhea.  I have experienced mild bloating and occasionally cramping but it pales in comparison to the symptoms associated with my severe constipation.  Honestly, I have cried multiple times from sheer relief and joy to find something that worked.  I should have listened to my GI doctor and tried it sooner.  If you’re nervous about trying it because of side effects, I highly recommend you at least try it.  I’m on the 145mg dose, but I also only weigh 115 lbs.

I have been taking 290mgs of Linzess for a couple of months and for me it has been a life saver. I have suffered from constipation for years and this is the only thing that keeps me going! I also take Senna and Miralax. I don't have any side effects that other people are talking about.

Linzess has been a blessing. I’m in my 50’s and have had constipation issues half my life. Later diagnosed with IBS, diverticulosis, and partial anal stenosis. My preferred regimen after a few years of using it, is early morning every other day. I make sure I have a 4 hour window of non-interrupted bathroom access. The 1st bowel movement begins at an 1 hour and 15 to 20 minutes after taking the medication. Then several more times for 3 and a half to 4 hours. Yes, it gives me diarrhea but that’s nothing compared to the years of pain and discomfort.

I’ve been using Linzess 145 MG For about a year and it definitely works but planning your day is a nightmare. What I’m trying to say to you is you don’t know from the time you take the pill when you’re going to have a bowel movement. It could be from one hour to four hours after taking the pill. Then there’s another problem you don’t have a consistent formed stool. It could be anywhere from diarrhea to normal and every day is different. Also you’re using bathroom anywhere from one hour to two hours or more. So how could you plan anything in your life in the morning. So any appointments have to be after 1 PM. Such as doctors or meeting up with friends etc. the only thing I could say is it definitely works and you’re not in pain from the bloating and the constipation but it’s a horrible life.

I have Been taking Linzess for about 3 months for IBS-C. At first I was taking it every day but it was resulting in daily diarrhea and cramping so I switched to every other day. I still get a little bit of cramping and loose stool when I take it but it doesn’t last long and I would prefer this than going 3-5 days without having a BM which results in even more bloating, cramping, and pain for me.

I took 72 mcg for IBS-C and CIC. I had severe diarrhea, bloating, cramping, rumbling, and fatigue. I switched from taking it once a day to every other day and still had the side effects. I then switched to once a week and still had terrible side effects. I could hardly function. For reference, I'm a 150lb 18 y/o female.

I been on 72mg for about a month in a half. I love it. I do drink a lot of water with it, I get a good cleaning out daily. I take 1 capsule first thing in the morning around 4am. It makes me use the bathroom about a hour later.
Linzess works great. I am extremely tired and have no appetite

Linzess had huge impact on my quality of life. You have to be careful to follow the dosing restrictions. Food within a certain period of dosing especially fatty food will elicit an expedited response from the medicine. This means that the symptoms you may feel which normally might be strung out over a period come fast and hard. I began eating oatmeal for breakfast every day. One high fiber package and one normal. I also keep miralax on hand to fine tune my GI system. Altogether, this medicine used correctly can make a vast difference. I sometimes worry that I have to use this medicine to feel normal but until they come up with something better for IBS-C it's about as good as it gets.

I have been taking Linzess for at least 5 years. I started on 145mg and it worked fine for a short period. I was then moved to 290mg and had the same outcome.  My case is not a typical one. I have lots of motility issues, MANY foods I can’t eat, and EXTEME IBS-C. I now have Pelvic Floor Dysfunction as well. I started taking 290mg of Linzess along with 10mL of Lactulose in the morning. The 2 together work very well!! I now have to take 30mL of Lactulose but I can count on everything working out just fine within an hour and a half after taking them 95% of the time.

I have IBS and my dr prescribed this as a miracle drug. Do not use this medication. I ended up in the ER . Diarrhea, blood pouring out and because of the drug developed colitis. Now I have gone through test after test and the same dr is ordering these tests. It was the Linzess and I pray the colonoscopy doesn’t show any inflammation which was the case after taking Linzess. I haven’t felt like myself since my hospital stay.

This medicine has been a life saver. I take my medicine everyday and I skip it on days I'm not near a restroom.

I couldn't retain fluid became dehydrated and then came the projectile vomit.  My legs were heavy, I was shivering,  had to go to ER

No one can really figure out what's going on so I've been "diagnosed" with IBS-C/CIC. I eat clean, work-out regularly and drink (water) like a fish! Took first dose as prescribed by my doctor one hour before eating dinner. Experienced l severe gas discomfort in my bowel that disturbed my sleep. I will not recommend this drug although it helped with the impaction quickly the smell is awful and the cramping and diarrhea is not worth it unless it’s last resort! It serves its purpose. The only negative thing about it is that it works too well.
